class_11.q: Who is known as the 'Father of History'?
class_11.e: Herodotus is known as the 'Father of History' because he was the first to collect historical data systematically and critically analyze it.

class_11.q: What was the main occupation of the people of the Indus Valley Civilization?
class_11.e: Agriculture was the primary occupation as the fertile land near rivers supported farming activities.

class_11.q: Which period is referred to as the Vedic Age?
class_11.e: The Vedic Age, marked by the composition of the Vedas, lasted from 1500 BCE to 500 BCE.
The Aryans composed the Rigveda, which is one of the oldest sacred texts.

class_11.q: What was the primary purpose of Ashoka's Dhamma policy?
class_11.c: To maintain harmony among diverse groups
class_11.e: Ashoka's Dhamma policy aimed to promote peace and harmony among people of different communities.

class_11.q: Which script was used in the Harappan civilization?
class_11.e: The script used by the Harappan civilization remains undeciphered and is termed an 'unknown script.'

class_11.q: What was the capital of the Mauryan Empire under Chandragupta Maurya?
class_11.e: Pataliputra (modern-day Patna) was the capital of the Mauryan Empire under Chandragupta Maurya.

class_11.q: Who was the founder of the Gupta Empire?
class_11.e: Chandragupta I is credited with founding the Gupta Empire around 320 CE.

class_11.q: The Sangam literature is associated with which region?
class_11.e: Sangam literature, composed in Tamil, is closely associated with South India.

class_11.q: Which Chinese traveler visited India during the Gupta period?
class_11.e: Fa-Hien visited India during the Gupta period and documented the social and religious conditions of the time.

class_12.q: Who led the Revolt of 1857 in Kanpur?
class_12.e: Nana Saheb was a prominent leader of the 1857 Revolt in Kanpur against British rule.

class_12.q: The Non-Cooperation Movement was launched in which year?
class_12.e: The Non-Cooperation Movement, led by Mahatma Gandhi, was launched in 1920 to oppose British policies.

class_12.q: Who wrote the book 'Discovery of India'?
class_12.e: 'Discovery of India' was authored by Jawaharlal Nehru during his imprisonment in 1942â€“1946.

class_12.q: The Partition of Bengal occurred in which year?
class_12.e: The British partitioned Bengal in 1905 to weaken the growing nationalist movement.

class_12.q: Who was the first Governor-General of independent India?
class_12.e: Lord Mountbatten served as the first Governor-General of independent India in 1947.

class_12.q: Which act introduced the principle of 'Separate Electorate' in India?
class_12.e: The Indian Councils Act of 1909 introduced separate electorates for Muslims.
Mahatma Gandhi coined 'Satyagraha' to describe his philosophy of nonviolent resistance.

class_12.q: Which of the following is considered the Magna Carta of Indian Education?
class_12.e: Wood's Despatch of 1854 laid the foundation for modern education in India, earning it the title 'Magna Carta of Indian Education.'

class_12.q: The Champaran Satyagraha was related to which issue?
class_12.e: The Champaran Satyagraha protested the exploitation of farmers growing indigo under oppressive conditions.

class_12.q: Who started the 'Servants of India Society'?
class_12.e: Gopal Krishna Gokhale founded the 'Servants of India Society' in 1905 to promote education and social reform.
